summary.p: 146 fol.; Writing surface: paper; Shelfmark: E. H. 225; Qurʾānic Text: Q 36, Q 48, Q 56, Q 67:1-80:42; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 220 x 330mm; Script style: ṯuluṯ; Date of production: 1242-43 CE.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 29f: "89 E. H. 225. Kur’ândan sureler. Aharlı ve vassaleli krem rengi ince kâğıt. 330mm boy ve 220mm eninde 146 yaprak. Sahifede harekeli iri sülüsle 120mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī eli ile 640 (1242-43) da istinsah edilmiştir. Sahife kenarları halkâri ve serlevha, güller, sure başları ve satır araları X. asır İran tezhibi ile müzeyyendir. Miklep, şemse, köşelik ve kitabeli vişneçürüğü deri cilt. Bu mücellette Yasin (36), Fatḥ (48), Vaḳiʿa (56), Mulk (67), Ḳalam (68), Ḥāḳḳa (69), Maʿāric (70), Nūḥ (71), Cinn (72), Muzzammil (73), Muddas̱s̱ir (74), Ḳıyama (75), Dahr, (76), Mursalāt (77), Nabaʾ (78), Nāziʿāt (79), ʿAbasa (80) ve Nas (114) suresine kadar bütün sureler yazılıdır. Müstensih için Bk. Tuhfe-i haṭṭaṭīn, s. 575."

This can be translated as follows: "89 E. H. 225. Sūras from the Qurʾān. Thin cream-colored sized paper with vaṣṣālī. 146 leaves of 330 mm height and 220 mm width. The text area written in large thuluth calligraphy with diacritics, [contains] 5 lines measuring 120 mm height. Copied by Yāḳūt al-Mustaʿṣimī in the year 640 (1242-43). The leaf edges are gilded (halkârî). And the serlevha, roses, sūra beginnings, and interlineary spaces illuminated with 10th-century Iranian illumination. Cherrybrown leather binding with flap (miklep), mandorla (şemse), corner pieces and inscription (kitabe). The one contains Q 36 (Sūra Yā-sīn), Q 48 (Sūra al-Fatḥ), Q 56 (Sūra al-Wāḳiʿa), Q 67 (Sūra al-Mulk), Q 68 (Sūra al-Qalam), Q 69 (Sūra al-Ḥāqqa), Q 70 (Sūra al-Maʿārij), Q 71 (Sūra Nūḥ), Q 72 (Sūra al-Jinn), Q 73 (Sūra al- Muzzammil), Q 74 (Sūra al-Muddaththir), Q 75 (Sūra al-Qiyāma), Q 76 (Sūra al-ʾInsān), Q 77 (Sūra al-Mursalāt), Q 78 (Sūra al-Nabaʾ), Q 79 (Sūra al-Nāziʿāt), Q 80 (Sūra ʿAbasa), Q 114 (Sūra al-Nās). For the copyist see. Tuhfe-i haṭṭaṭīn, p. 575.”
